NoteHistorique : The European Commission (EC) "take part in the work of the Organization [OECD]" (Supplementary Protocol no.1 to the convention on the OECD), in other words: a "full participant" in OECD bodies since the establishment of OECD. This is confirmed by Council Resolution in 2004 [C(2004)132/FINAL]. In 1982 the OECD Council has recognized that "a member of the EC could sit on the bureau of a subsidiary body of the OECD and could chair such bodies" [C/M(82)24]. There has been a recent discussion on the participation in the decision making process, in other words: exercising de facto full membership status (beyond the Supplementary Protocol no.1). An internal inquiry in April 2011 has produced a list of bodies in which the EC has full membership status: - Co-operative Action Programme on Local Economic and Employment Development (LEED) [C(2010)39 and CORR 1 and C/M(2010)5] - Development Assistance Committee (DAC) [Resolution of the Special Economic Committee of 13 January 1960 and OECD(60)13] - Special Programme on the Control of Chemicals [C(78)127(final)] - Steel Committee [C(78)171(Final)] - Council Working Party No. 3 on Policies for the Promotion of Better International Payments Equilibrium (WP3) To make matters more complicated the delegation of the European Commission has been renamed "Delegation of the European Union" following the Lisbon Treaty's entry into force on 1 December 2009.
